The animal inventory at the time of inspection was 32 adult dogs and 31 puppies (a total of 63 dogs). This number
exceeds the maximum number of 50 animals allowed under the current license. The USDA license authorizes a specific
number of animals to ensure that the facility and personnel possess adequate facilities, employees and education to
provide sufficient husbandry to the regulated animals. A licensee must obtain a new license before any change resulting
in more than the authorized number of animals on hand at any single point in time during the period of licensure. The
licensee must reapply for a license that properly reflects the number of regulated animals under the license or reduce the
number of regulated animals to a number which is under the maximum threshold authorized under the current license.
Correct by January 30, 2024.

Disposition records for dogs are not being made, kept, and maintained on the APHIS Form 7006 Record of Disposition of
Dogs and Cats. Use of APHIS Form 7006 allows for complete and accurate identification as well as tracking of animals
being used in regulated activities. Each dealer and exhibitor shall utilize the APHIS Form 7006 Record of Disposition of
Dogs and Cats to make, keep, and maintain disposition information or request a variance if using a computerized record
keeping system that makes use of APHIS Form 7006 unsuitable.
Correct by January 30, 2024.

Several of the sheltered enclosures in dog kennels 1 and 2 have surfaces which have become worn or chewed such that
bare wood is now exposed. These surfaces which can be in direct contact with the dogs are no longer impervious to
moisture, can no longer be readily cleaned and sanitized, and thus could harbor agents such as bacteria which can be
harmful to the health of the dogs. Ensure that all walls, boxes, houses, dens, and other surfaces in contact with the dogs
and their litters are impervious to moisture.
Correct by February 20, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.

Requirements and application 
The animal inventory at the time of inspection was 32 adult dogs and 31 puppies (a total of 63 dogs). This number 
exceeds the maximum number of 50 animals allowed under the current license. The USDA license authorizes a specific 
number of animals to ensure that the facility and personnel possess adequate facilities, employees and education to 
provide sufficient husbandry to the regulated animals. A licensee must obtain a new license before any change resulting 
in more than the authorized number of animals on hand at any single point in time during the period of licensure. The 
licensee must reapply for a license that properly reflects the number of regulated animals under the license or reduce the 
number of regulated animals to a number which is under the maximum threshold authorized under the current license. 
 
Correct by January 30, 2024. 
2.75(a)(2) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
Disposition records for dogs are not being made, kept, and maintained on the APHIS Form 7006 Record of Disposition of 
Dogs and Cats. Use of APHIS Form 7006 allows for complete and accurate identification as well as tracking of animals 
being used in regulated activities. Each dealer and exhibitor shall utilize the APHIS Form 7006 Record of Disposition of 
Dogs and Cats to make, keep, and maintain disposition information or request a variance if using a computerized record 
keeping system that makes use of APHIS Form 7006 unsuitable.

3.3(e)(1)(iii) 
   
Sheltered housing facilities. 
Several of the sheltered enclosures in dog kennels 1 and 2 have surfaces which have become worn or chewed such that 
bare wood is now exposed. These surfaces which can be in direct contact with the dogs are no longer impervious to 
moisture, can no longer be readily cleaned and sanitized, and thus could harbor agents such as bacteria which can be 
harmful to the health of the dogs. Ensure that all walls, boxes, houses, dens, and other surfaces in contact with the dogs 
and their litters are impervious to moisture.

Correct by February 20, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
